definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point

sentences.english: She was burbling on her unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 她絮絮不休她的失业问题。

sentences.english: She kept on dingdonging in my ears the whole day.
sentences.chinese: 她整天在我耳边絮絮不休。

sentences.english: On the way back, she told me a lot of hum about.
sentences.chinese: 回来的路上，她絮絮叨叨地跟我说了很多。

sentences.english: Long-winded descriptions are the death of many good speeches.
sentences.chinese: 絮絮叨叨的长篇大论是演讲的死穴。

sentences.english: He is forever croaking about his problems.
sentences.chinese: 他老是絮絮叨叨地说她的那些问题。

sentences.english: She rambled on about her children.
sentences.chinese: 她絮絮不休地谈她的孩子。
难道你就从不絮絮叨叨吗？

sentences.english: I would have taken the time to listen to my grandfather  ramble about his youth.
sentences.chinese: 我会抽出时间听爷爷絮絮叨叨讲他年轻时的往事。

sentences.english: I would have taken the time to listen to my grandfather ramble about his youth.
sentences.chinese: 我会抽出骼时间听爷爷絮絮叨叨讲他年轻时的往事。

sentences.english: The principal waffled on about exam results but no one was listening.
sentences.chinese: 校长絮絮叨叨地谈着考试结果，但是谁也没有听进去。

definition: long-winded/garrulous/to talk endlessly without getting to the point
to chat with a low voice
looking up expectantly/speaking softly (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [yu2 yu2])
in a whisper/in a low voice (idiom)

pinyin: you3 yi1 da1 mei2 yi1 da1

definition: to be chattersome/to talk on and on without stopping/to nag
whispering in a low voice (idiom); murmuring
